chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Karras, Justin Paul

records.addlTxt: Information filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Defendant waives further reading of the information. Defendant pleads not guilty to all counts.  Not guilty plea received by the court.  Bond to Continue.

10:05 AM Defendant Justin Paul Karras in court.  Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in court for Justin Paul Karras.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court for State of Wisconsin. State calls Cody Tomlinson.  Tomlinson appears via ZOOM video.  Tomlinson is sworn.  Schieffer exams Tomlinson.  Identification of defendant is stipulated.  Helgeson x-exams Tomlinson. Tomlinson is excused.  Schieffer gives argument and requests bind over for trial.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
from Defendant's Employer requesting voluntary income assignment be dismissed and Mr. Karras will personally make the payments.

Court confirms address and phone number. Officer Tomlin may appear via zoom for the PH. Court adjourned at 10:37 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

from DE to reset until he obtains counsel. To ADA Joseph Schieffer for review. eif
per JRG 7/6/22 - approved for Officer Cody Tomlinson to appear via zoom is granted. E: DA & Atty. eif
to Have Witness Appear Via Zoom for 7/8/22 filed by ADA Joseph Schieffer. To JRG for review. eif
Preliminary hearing on July 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:00 PM Defendant Justin Paul Karras appears in Court, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. DE did fill out the PFAC but has chosen to retain counsel. ADA Schieffer states he called the Officer off because DE did not have counsel. ADA Schieffer has no objection to rescheduling but would like a waiver of counsel filed if DE does not have counsel. Court will reset the PH. DE to notify the Court immediately if he is having problems obtaining counsel. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:05 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:04 AM Defendant Justin Paul Karras appears in Court, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. DE states he does not qualify for PD and has not completed a PFAC. ADA Schieffer states he released the Officer today because DE did not have counsel. Court orders DE to fill a PFAC today. Court will reset the PH. Court adjourned at 11:08 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:18 PM Defendant Justin Paul Karras appears in Court, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. DE thought the PD would be representing him. DE to contact the PD's Office. ADA Schieffer has no objection to resetting the PH. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:21 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores.
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Def from PCJ

3:25 PM Defendant Justin Paul Karras appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Scott Selmer appears by phone, DA Halle Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. DA Hatch is requesting a $5,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS, NTE & NTO, no objection. Court so orders.  DE does qualify for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:34 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
